item.title: Labor Tax in a Dynamic Search-and-Matching Model
item.description: During recessions, large negative labor income shocks become more common, while significant positive shocks become less frequent. This is particularly true for low wage workers. A substantial fraction of the work force is likely to experience considerable cyclical welfare losses. Can the labor income tax schedule exacerbate or mitigate these fluctuations? We analyse this question in a search-and-matching model with heterogeneous workers and aggregate shocks. This is a joint project with Nicol√≤ Dalvit.
